name: order_id
description: Customer Order ID as in ID in Retailer's Order Management System (OMS). is always unique regardless of store id or date.

name: store_id
description: MFC location id

name: spoke_id
description: Spoke location id that customer wants to pickup from (in case of service-type="Pickup") or Store ID that will be the starting point for the second-leg (last-mile) of delivery.

name: creation_datetime
description: Order creation date and time. If skipped from the retailer then set up by current DateTime by default.

name: shift_number
description: ID of a shift. Truck departure will be organized in shifts, therefore, MFC operations are revolving around these shifts. Should be sequential (growing monotonously) within a day (example valid: 55, 58, 61). Default: hour of the day.

name: route_number
description: Route ID for the first leg of logistics. In case of one-leg logistics this will be direct routes from MFC-stores to customer homes. In case of two-step logistics, this will routes from MFC-stores to pickup-stores or pickup-points. If blank, order is believed to be "unrouted". Can be updated up until order is loaded into truck. If "Pickup" this means order will be picked up in hub-store. Route-number can be changed only if it changes from "UNROUTED" to any other "route-number". Route-number cannot be changed if TO CO status is "Picked" or any other TO CO status which follows after "Picked".

name: stop_number
description: Number of stop within requested route. Stops are sequential, i.e. 1 2 3 4. With prefix zeroes aligned to three digits long. For "Pickup" orders this will be sequential "Pickup" order number within a day within a store (no relation to staging addresses). Can be changed after cut-off time. Stop-number can be changed only if it changes from "UNROUTED" to any other "stop-number". Stop-number cannot be changed if TO CO status is "Picked" or any other TO CO status which follows after "Picked".

name: total_shift_orders
description: Total number of customer orders known by retailer's system for a given shift (same as shift of current order) at the moment of request. Value must be >= 0.

name: total_route_orders
description: Total number of customer orders known by retailer's system for a given route within a given shift (same as route+shift of current order) at the moment of request. Value must be >= 0 and =< totalShiftOrders.

name: fulfillment_datetime
description: The date-time when Order SHOULD be fulfilled

name: stage_by_datetime
description: Date-time for when customer order should be staged. I.e. ready to be picked up by truck for the first leg. Stage-by-datetime is always in the interval of time between cut-off time and the beginning of the slot. Stage-by-datetime can be changed only before the cut-off time.

name: shipping_label
description: Shipping label lines, additional info should be presented on the shipping label.

name: splitted
description: Flag is Order is already split (moved to the Platform (Couch DB))

name: cutoff_datetime
description: Date-time when picking of Order in the MFC SHOULD be startedValue is set after split. Before that - value is 'null]

name: corp_order_id
description: Retailer external order-id. Can be not unique

name: empty_tom_items
description: Definition if after split NO items can be picked in MFC (valid for cases when ALL items in the Order are OOS)

name: cancelled_by_client
description: Definition if Order was canceled by Retailer (Cancel Order API call was sent)

name: splitted_by_client
description: Definition if Order was split by Retailer (SPLIT Order API call was sent)

name: tote_estimate
description: Estimation of Totes to be used for Order picking

name: service_window_start
description: The date-time when Order SHOULD be fulfilled

name: preliminary_batch_id
description: ID of connceted Preliminary batch (link to preliminary_batch table)

name: order_note
description: Note, provided by client
